mdRecord.dcterms:description: Window grille and view of cladding, facade

Rostone is a synthetic product composed of shale, alkaline earths, and limestone quarry waste. It has a variety of colors and can be produce in slabs, panels and other forms to exact dimensions. It was advertised as having the properties resembling limestone. The advantages to rostone was that it could be produced in any dimension and in several colors. The material was much less durable than initial tests indicated. The sheathing on the Rostone House began to fail approximately ten years after it was installed; the house was reclad with Permastone in 1950. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wieboldt-Rostone_House [work]
